meanings.definition: A collection of literary extracts or passages.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's florilegium of famous quotes inspired the students.
meanings.sent2: The library's florilegium of poems showcased various poets.
meanings.sent3: The florilegium of jokes made everyone laugh during the party.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a florilegium of memories, each one precious.
meanings.sent5: The florilegium of stories painted a vivid picture of the past.

meanings.definition: A compilation of writings or artwork.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a florilegium of ancient manuscripts.
meanings.sent2: The anthology was a florilegium of diverse voices and styles.
meanings.sent3: The florilegium of doodles on his notebook amused his classmates.
meanings.sent4: Her room was a florilegium of paintings, each telling a story.
meanings.sent5: The florilegium of photographs captured moments in time beautifully.

meanings.definition: A selection of flowers or plants.
meanings.sent1: The florilegium of roses in the garden bloomed brightly.
meanings.sent2: She created a florilegium of wildflowers picked from the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The florilegium of succulents on her windowsill brought joy.
meanings.sent4: The field was a florilegium of colors, a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The florilegium of tulips in the vase added a touch of elegance.
